newsitem.title: TOGO: Zaire's Mobutu leaves Togo for Morocco.
newsitem.headline: Zaire's Mobutu leaves Togo for Morocco.

text.p: Zaire's ousted president Mobutu Sese Seko left the West African state of Togo for Morocco on Friday on the presidential plane of Togolese president Gnassingbe Eyadema, officials said.
Witnesses at the airport said Mobutu, who is fighting cancer, was supported on both sides by aides as he climbed onto the plane, which left at 0910 GMT.
Mobutu arrived in Lome from his jungle palace at Gbadolite in northern Zaire on Sunday night, a day after Laurent Kabila's rebels marched into the capital Kinshasa.
He initially landed in Togo for a technical stopover but Togolese sources said the government had reluctantly agreed to let him stay longer because of his state of health.
French Cooperation Minister Jacques Godfrain hinted on Wednesday that France might be prepared to admit Mobutu for medical treatment.
Morocco said on Thursday it recognised Kabila's Democratic Republic of Congo and wished to pursue relations of brotherhood and cooperation.
